I was born in Newcastle Liverpool Street o- off Percy Street but its no more now it's finished yes well oh I was over there a long time I was bred and born in Newcastle and I come over here when I had . two babies I had Sarah no Sarah and Joe over Newcastle and when I come here I had the third one our Norah yes all the time yes oho I was down in Cowper Street first thats on Askew Road and then 3: I come up here and I've been her ever since well I think they're both the same yes I made myself quite happy in Cowper Street I was about eleven year there Cowper Street and then I come up here been here ever since and oh it was quite nice at one time here but oh its getting awful now well they're getting all the little kids in oh and its ridiculous they're going interfering with the gardens and everything oh yes yes oh aye no I've never been away at all not from here oh yes yes the Tynesiders are theyre theyre friendly up here very friendly they were born in Newcastle I think my father was born in born in Durham somewhere oh yes yes they did oho he was just a labourer well he was a crane man in Armstrongs I'm seventy six well I think I've mostly been I've mostly done home help I just went to I went to St Agnes' school in the Catholic school in Newcastle and I left school when I was fourteen and I just was at home cos my mother was poorly and I was always kept at home but I've always gone out looking after people thats been poorly sort of like a home help you know no I used to just for myself oho I used to look after my two daughters when they were out at work and try and help them do their cleaning and that for them oh I've always found housework alright yes well I was well I liked school but it was getting monotonous I was so long in the last class I was sick of it there was nothing like what they have now for them in my day when they were at school well it is oh yes educations better well there's nothing else for them there's no work or anything they've just got to stop at school oh yes yes because they're just running the streets wild I've a grandson goes to St Cuthberts grammar school in Newcastle oho two thats Arthur was at St Cuthberts grammar school thats thats two grandsons I've had there this last one he's finished his exams and he's just waiting for the results now oho they have to wait that long for to get aye cos he's he wont if he hasn't passed his exams he'll not get back to school but his father's going to send him to a college of education well not much they're getting better they get better education and everything now well they've got to use a certain amount of discipline to keep them under but nowadays if you you see the teachers are frightened to do anything to the children because they go to their mothers and then
